content: Being an owner of this {{productName}}, you must transfer the ownership to another user before you can disable your account. Please choose a new owner to proceed.

comment.text: This translation key is used to display a message informing users that they must transfer ownership before disabling their account. It appears in a modal dialog prompting users to delete their profile. The user must choose a new owner to proceed.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Arabic translation uses "لكونك" which is a bit formal and less common in everyday conversation. While grammatically correct, it could be softened for better user experience.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider using a more conversational phrase like "بما أنك مالك" or "لأنك مالك".

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "hesabınızı silməzdən əvvəl" translates to "before deleting your account." However, the English says 'before you can disable your account.' While similar, 'disable' is a more accurate reflection of the English meaning in this context. 'Silmək' implies complete deletion, which isn't necessarily what the product does.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Bu {{productName}}-in sahibi olaraq, hesabınızı deaktiv etməzdən əvvəl sahibliyi başqa istifadəçiyə ötürməlisiniz. Davam etmək üçün yeni sahibkar seçin.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'sahib' (owner) is repeated, which can feel clunky. While grammatically correct, rephrasing could improve flow.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Bu {{productName}}-in sahibi olaraq, hesabınızı deaktiv etməzdən əvvəl sahibliyi başqa istifadəçiyə ötürməlisiniz. Davam etmək üçün yeni istifadəçi seçin.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English phrase 'disable your account' is translated as 'odstraněním svého účtu'. While technically correct (removaling your account), 'disable' usually implies a temporary action. A more appropriate translation could be 'zakázáním svého účtu' which means 'deactivating your account'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Pokud jste vlastníkem tohoto prostoru {{productName}}, musíte před zakázáním svého účtu převést vlastnictví na jiného uživatele. Chcete-li pokračovat, zvolte nového vlastníka.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "Ole hyvä ja valitse uusi omistaja jatkaaksesi" is a bit formal and less natural for this context. A more conversational tone would be better.  'Jatkaaksesi' can be shortened and rephrased.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Valitse uusi omistaja, niin pääset jatkamaan.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Armenian translation uses a hyphen in 'productName-ի'. While hyphens are used in Armenian, the English uses curly braces {{productName}}. This inconsistency should be reviewed for consistency with the application's implementation.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider mirroring the English format using curly braces {{productName}} in the Armenian translation, if that aligns with the application's display logic. If a hyphen is necessary for grammatical correctness in Armenian, ensure this is the standard practice for similar placeholders.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "自分のアカウントを削除する前に" (before deleting your account) is slightly awkward. A more natural phrasing would be "自分のアカウントを停止する前に" (before disabling your account) to align with the English 'disable'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: 自分のアカウントを停止する前に

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Lao translation uses a comma (,) after "ເຈົ້າຂອງ {{productName}} ນີ້" which can feel slightly unnatural in Lao. It would flow better without it.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: ການເປັນເຈົ້າຂອງ {{productName}} ນີ້ ກ່ອນທີ່ທ່ານຈະສາມາດລຶບບັນຊີ ທ່ານຕ້ອງໂອນຄວາມເປັນເຈົ້າຂອງໃຫ້ກັບຜູ້ໃຊ້ອື່ນ. ກະລຸນາເລືອກເຈົ້າຂອງໃໝ່ເພື່ອດຳເນີນການຕໍ່.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Latvian translation includes multiple gendered endings (īpašniekam (-cei), lietotājam (-i)). While grammatically correct, it's verbose and can be simplified for a smoother user experience. Consider a more neutral phrasing if possible, or explore if the platform supports gender selection for the user.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider rephrasing for brevity and neutrality. For example: 'Lai varētu izdzēst savu kontu, jums kā šī {{productName}} īpašniekam ir jānodod īpašumtiesības citam lietotājam. Lai turpinātu, lūdzu, izvēlieties jaunu īpašnieku.'

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While "Lai varētu izdzēst savu kontu" is technically correct, a more natural phrasing might be "Lai jūs varētu izdzēst savu kontu." Adding 'jūs' makes the sentence flow better in Latvian and feels more natural.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Lai jūs varētu izdzēst savu kontu

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'În calitate de proprietar al spațiului {{productName}} înainte de a putea șterge contul dvs' is a bit awkward. The 'înainte de a putea șterge contul dvs' part is not the most natural way to express the requirement.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: În calitate de proprietar al {{productName}}, trebuie să transferați dreptul de proprietate altui utilizator înainte de a putea șterge contul.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The original English uses the term 'disable your account'. The Romanian translation 'șterge contul dvs' translates to 'delete your account'. While functionally similar, 'disable' implies a temporary action, while 'delete' is permanent. This can lead to user confusion.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: În calitate de proprietar al {{productName}}, trebuie să transferați dreptul de proprietate altui utilizator înainte de a putea dezactiva contul.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation of "Being an owner of this {{productName}}," is a bit literal and could be more naturally expressed in Sinhala. A more idiomatic translation would improve readability.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: ඔබ මෙම {{productName}} හි හිමියෙකු වශයෙන්,

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "disable your account" is translated as "ඔබගේ ගිණුම මකා දැමීමට" which means 'to delete your account'. While close, 'disable' implies a temporary action.  A better translation would reflect that.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: ඔබගේ ගිණුම අයින් කිරීමට

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The variable '{{productName}}' is present in the Sinhala translation but it is not clear if it will be correctly rendered in the UI.  It needs to be ensured that this variable is handled properly during rendering.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Ensure that the '{{productName}}' variable is correctly handled by the rendering engine.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'disable your account' is translated as 'vymazaním svojho účtu'. While technically correct (vymazanie means deletion), 'disable' implies a temporary action. A more accurate translation would be 'zakázaním svojho účtu' or 'zablokovaním svojho účtu'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Ako vlastník tohto priestoru {{productName}} musíte pred zakázaním/zablokovaním svojho účtu previesť vlastníctvo na iného používateľa. Ak chcete pokračovať, vyberte nového vlastníka.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'Being an owner of this {{productName}}' is not accurately reflected in the Slovenian translation. 'Ker ste lastnik tega {{productName}} prostora' literally translates to 'Because you are the owner of this {{productName}} space.' While understandable, it's a bit clunky and doesn't capture the nuance of the original.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Ker ste lastnik/ica tega {{productName}},

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The original English uses '{{productName}}' to indicate a variable. The Slovenian translation also uses '{{productName}}'. While technically correct, it might be beneficial to ensure consistency with existing Slovenian variable syntax (if there is one) to avoid confusion for translators/developers.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Maintain {{productName}} or adapt to Slovenian variable syntax (e.g., {{product_name}}).

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Serbian translation includes an unnecessary hyphen after 'productName'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Remove the hyphen after 'productName'. The corrected phrase would be: 'productName'

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'productName' is not properly formatted. It should be rendered as a variable within the translated text.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Pošto ste vlasnik ovog {{productName}}-a, morate preneti vlasništvo na drugog korisnika da biste mogli da obrišete svoj nalog. Izaberite novog vlasnika da biste nastavili.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The use of 'Pošto' implies a causal relationship. A more direct translation of 'Being' might be better suited. While not strictly wrong, it introduces a slightly different nuance.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Budući da ste vlasnik ovog {{productName}}-a, morate preneti vlasništvo na drugog korisnika da biste mogli da obrišete svoj nalog. Izaberite novog vlasnika da biste nastavili.
